p: During the test of glutamate nociception, we observe that animals orally treated with T. capitatus EO at doses of 3, 6, and 12 mg/kg ( Figure 1), reduced the licking time from control (100.3 ± 11.9 s) to 84.8 ± 12.2, 62.7.6 ± 9.9 and 41.5 ± 12.7 s ( p < 0.05), respectively. As expected, the standard drug morphine (5 mg/kg) decreased the nociceptive response to 10.3 ± 3.4 s from control ( p < 0.05).
